definition: to decline/to die out/decline and fall
to decline/to wane/to become weak or feeble
to die/to lose/to be gone/to flee/deceased

sentences.english: The declining family circumstances of the Compsons is the symbol of the dying away of the old South tradition.
sentences.chinese: 康普生的家境衰败就是蓄奴制旧南方衰亡的缩影。

sentences.english: It is a book that records the fall of the Third Reich.
sentences.chinese: 它是一本记载第三帝国衰亡的书。

sentences.english: Finally the Northwest Army's suppressing the Heavenly Gate Society marked the Red Spears' falling.
sentences.chinese: 西北军对天门会的镇压标志着红枪会的衰亡。

sentences.english: It has its own  rhythm and beat, its internal cycles of growth and  decay.
sentences.chinese: 人生自有其韵律和节奏，自有内在的生成与衰亡。

sentences.english: And who knows but a crystal is mist in decay?
sentences.chinese: 但有谁知道那水晶只是衰亡的雾？

sentences.english: Toby has spent his life comparing the way cililiza- tions rise and fall.
sentences.chinese: 托比一生都在比较各种文明是怎样兴盛衰亡的。

sentences.english: At this time, Erlitou Culture displayed a trend of decline and fall.
sentences.chinese: 二里头文化势力在本期呈现的是一种衰亡趋势。

sentences.english: We are studying the decline and fall of ancient Rome.
sentences.chinese: 我们正在研究古罗马的衰亡。

sentences.english: All this is not to antedate the demise of the empire.
sentences.chinese: 这一切不会使帝国提前衰亡。

definition: to be destroyed/to become extinct/to perish/to die out/to destroy/to exterminate
to fall/to drop/to decline/to deteriorate/to go downhill
(of a nation) to be destroyed/subjugation/vanquished nation
prosperity and decline (of a kingdom)/rise and fall
from prosperity to decline/at its peak before the decline
